title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in person with two staff members, they asked questions about my resume, and it was pretty easy. The interview was in person, and there were multiple in the same room at the same time. However, it was still private.
Interview Questions: Describe why you think you would be a good fit.

title: Senior Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to recruiter on LinkedIn and made an introduction. Application was forwarded by a talent specialist to the department. During my interview, I met with multiple members of the finance department in one-on-one meetings.
Interview Questions: Mix of technical and behavioral questions. Received background info on the department's needs, goals, and structure.

title: Fund Raiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: First I did a phone interview, then an in person interview. Questions seemed to be geared most towards experience and fit with their current team. There were no curve ball questions.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick and easy. The questions were typical and straight forward. I had one virtual interview with two people. It was very relaxed without a bunch of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: They asked various questions regarding past employment.

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy and not stressful at all. Great for first timers. Go with the flow. Not scary. If you are looking for an entry level position this is great for you
Interview Questions: What do you look forward to most in this job

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a member of the HR department to set up a zoom interview with 2 of the ER physicians. The interview went very well and the physicians were friendly and informative. HR called me about a week later.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask very specific questions, just if I would be ok working nights and weekends. It was more of a conversational interview, and I asked most of the questions.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Let’s start by very clean environment . My hiring manager was super cool . She made me feel very comfortable. She let me know she wanted me on team I’m super excited
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Corporate Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I had a total of 3 interviews, including one where I was to provide work samples/do customer service examples in person in real time. The first two interviews were via Zoom due to covid.
Interview Questions: To provide a customer outreach example email

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: You discuss publications, your future aspirations, any funding or continuous funding, your goals, and experiences. Make sure to read lab publications and have questions. Review whole department and ask lots of questions
Interview Questions: What do you want to do?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have met with the doctors and will meet with the other coordinators. One meeting was in person, and the others were by Zoom. I am still in process, so no offer received yet.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself.

title: Summer Camp Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: basic interview held on zoom to know the basic knowledge of the student and test his communication skills and his compatability with the team and cultural exposure to handle different people
Interview Questions:
1. tell me about urself
2. what made you apply for this position

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the supervisors and they asked about my resume and classes I was taking at SLU, and what I wanted to do after I graduated, and why I wanted the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Human Resource Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Thorough process. Received opportunity to meet my direct team members. Spoke with the VP and the other managers as well. I would recommend Saint Louis University to other associates of mine as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was online or virtual, during 2021. They ask you for your skills, backrground, they review applicant job description. Read and review Mission statement. It is just a formality when you already have talked with who is going to be your supervisor.
Interview Questions: Expectations that you have at SLU

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process occurred on my admissions tour date. It was informal, based primarily on my request for funding options before I committed to the university. I specified what my professional interests were and my existing skills, then they presented a few GA positions that I could choose from.
Interview Questions: What kind of project would you be comfortable taking on?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process begins with an online application that includes including resume and recommendation letter and then once a person passed that along with a gpa requirement you are asked to come in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions were asked such as "name a time when..."

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I am well qualified to make excellent decisions and make sure that everyone is on the same plan as I am.  If anything goes wrong I will make sure it comes out as well as it should.
Interview Questions: Nothing, they did not ask me anything.

title: Assistant Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It’s so good working here. Good environmental, good atmosphere, and easy to adapt working in this place. The lecture is really kind to me, and other lectures are good for me too.
Interview Questions: Why i want to working in this place?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Had a great interview with the department heads and was told to expect a follow up, including being sent an online questionnaire to fill out. The hiring manager took over a week to respond post interview even though the position needed to be urgently filled, and provided no next steps, simply asking in an email what salary expectations where. After responding, received absolutely no follow up despite reaching out to do so.  Application was moved to “on record” with no additional follow up. An incredibly disappointing process for such a reputable institution.
Interview Questions: How are you with handling multiple projects at once.

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was good.  The process was fast and efficient. The people involved were nice and professional.   I had a phone interview then a peer interview with current staff. They gave me a tour of the hospital and thoroughly went though the process of the hospital .
Interview Questions: Name a time that you had a difficult time in the OR. How did you deal with it?

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: First I Applied for the position online, then they called me for the phone interview. After the phone interview we set up the in person interview. At the interview they called a few days later to offer me position.
Interview Questions: A time a patient was being difficult and how I handled it?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: met with HR then to the manager and team interviewing me. A panel asked difficult questions then was left with staff RN and supervisor. Then the staff nurse gave me a tour and escourted me back out of the department
Interview Questions: several difficult questions

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Written questions were submitted with an application followed by an interview with professional staff members and current resident advisors.  The questions were not surpising based on the prior information meetings and other resources that are available online for similar positions.
Interview Questions: What is your conflict management style?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: My experience has been smooth. I received a phone call from Human Resources.  I had interview set up. Interview day was very smooth and all staff were extremely nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: I was asked about and person or professional goals I have made and if I was successful or not.?

title: Executive Director Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The process was warm and welcoming from the recruiter to the panel that interviewed me. Everyone I encountered was professional and kind. My questions were answered appropriately. The anticipated anxiety went to a zero after meeting with the Recruiter Karina who was warm and inviting.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you felt there was an ethical issues and how did you handle it.

title: Desk Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview. It was led by other students so it was fairly straight forward but I liked it a lot. I think the whole prcoess is easy too because once you have the job you can keep it the following years
Interview Questions: Are you able to work later hours

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for multiple different departments and all were similar interviews. Focused on not just experience but more so who you are as a person. Questions pertained to my interests, why I think I would be a good fit for said job, etc.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself after graduation?

title: Operations Assistant With Campus Rec Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: After applying for a job through handshake, I received an email in a few weeks for an in-person interview. They inform you if you get the job after a week.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your strengths? 
Tell me about yourself? 
Why do you want to work in the Rec?

title: Help Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick and painless. There is only one round of interviews and it was behavioral. The job position is available for all students who apply and does not require any experience.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience with customer service?

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a comfortable interview for me they made me feel really relaxed to answer my questions and it went by very quickly to me and I thank them very much for that making me feel as if I was already a team player
Interview Questions: Tell me something that you did for someone that really made their day

title: Care Partner II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed for a phone interview the day after I applied online. During the phone interview, an in-person interview was scheduled for the following week. The in-person interview was approximately 1 hour long that included 10 "situational questions" like the one listed below.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest mistake you've made in a job and how did you rectify it?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Process took about two weeks. Applied on Handshake and was asked to interview a few weeks later. The interview itself was pretty standard; I was asked basic questions you'd be asked at any job interview (strengths, weaknesses, why you want the job, etc).
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Call Center Telemarketer - Annual Giving Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview and then an in-person interview. Everything had to do with your phone presence. As long as you're confident, then you should be fine. Questions are easy.
Interview Questions: Why should someone give to SLU?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was none. I took the class, did well, and saw that the professor needed help. I came up to them one day after class and offered to become their TA. Here I am today.
Interview Questions: When can you work?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well.  The management was very open and caring during the conversation.  They did not belittle and helped with any questions that I had.  They were real and not deceiving
Interview Questions: Why Versant?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview with lab director and a professor. HR and management were talked to afterwards, they were extremely disorganized and unsure of the hiring process. The people who ran the lab seemed to know what they were doing but the management seemed awful.
Interview Questions: Greatest weakness?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very Pleasant and interesting, I was very comfortable, they where very welcoming . Im normally a nervous rack, but with them, they made me feel part of the team already.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: easy interview process, did not ask many questions, applied in person, background and research presentation, it took a few days to reply my email and a few weeks till I got the position.
Interview Questions: previous work experiences mainly and why you choose Saint Louis University.

title: Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Could have been more professional. They told me that I was to meet two doctors, one at a time, for 15 min each. Instead, in the first interview there was a doctor and an Office Manager. I was really thrown aback as I had not prepared to address this person's question nor to acknowledge who they were. This was a blow below the belt. To make things worse, at some stage this woman pointed out I needed a special kind of training called CT training as I am not a researcher in medicine. This made me feel inadequate and uncomfortable as the job ad did not mention this as a requirement for the post. For the record, CT training is free online and anyone can complete, even if they do not have formal training in research (i.e. PhD). When I pointed this out to the HR contact after the interview, I got an email back from one of the doctors saying it was necessary. Well, thanks a lot for saying so too late...
Interview Questions: What is your experience of clinical trials research?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy if you bring your best self. You are there because they liked what they saw on your application and want to discuss it further. I submitted my application with a resume AND cover letter (important, since they do read those). I received a call (1:1 phone interview), then scheduled a time to have an in-person 1:1 interview, and then received multiple interviews. After this, I just had to take the assessment, I believe (which you need to brush up on Microsoft programs for [no shortcuts] and pretend to know how to handle disputes at a fake company for a fake scenario. It took weeks to get a call-back, but after that I received an offer and took it. I only had to go back for a drug and health screening.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: IT Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was actually fairly brief and straight forward.  I met with two individuals, the hiring manager and one other team member.  We discussed my resume and I was asked various high level questions about my knowledge of industry practices and my ability to adapt and work.
Interview Questions: What did I feel about this being a Jesuit institution and why did I want to work in a culture such as this?

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Apply for a job that fits you first.What's your interest.? Secondly, wait patiently for a response back if not call make the company received everything that's been asked of. Once in ask questions pertaining to the job always smile and eye contact
Interview Questions: Why do I want to leave my job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't your typical face to face. Being a student led to me being able to choose from a multitude of options like which educational department to work in. Sure you may not have been able to get your first choice but depending on your preference and timeliness of applying you should be fine.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were which department did you wish to work in.

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was nice and wanted to get to know me, my background, as well as what I wanted to achieve in the position if I was offered the position
Interview Questions: What my work history was

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was on skype.  I was asked about my background research, hobbies. Took roughly eight to ten minutes. Friendly faculties attended the interview. also asked which courses i like or disliked
Interview Questions: Can you describe your research?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Comically lengthy process.  HR seemed to drag its feet at every turn.  Have heard that managers in various depts get very frustrated by the continued delays.  Communication during the process was at best haphazard.
Interview Questions: What did I know about the Jesuit tradition of the school?

title: Public Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and time consuming. They treat the hire process like a police department. Written test, psychological exam, multiple interviews. Hiring board with multiple supervisors in the room during interview. Had to dress in business attire. For being a female, I wore a navy blue pin stripes suit. You must travel about 45 mins away (depending on where you live ) for a psych exam, that takes a few hours . Then you have to go back a week later to review your results with the Doctor...very time consuming. Off site drug test. Must get medical screening including mandatory flu shots yearly and TB tests.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Slu?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with on supervisor followed by a panel interview of four of my would be supervisors. No skills test, but other departments at SLU have used skill tests for the administrative secretary hiring process.
Interview Questions:
How is the Jesuit mission and values important to you?
Why do you want to work at Saint Louis University?
How has your past work experience prepared you for this role?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call from one of their financial co-ordinator to set up an interview with four of their employees in about one week. It was very casual and conversational interviews with a few technical questions.The questions were about the previous experience and the educational background.
Interview Questions: The interview question were pretty easy including previous experience and educational background. The atmosphere was friendly and nice.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: I just submitted a resume.  There was no interview process to worry about.  I recommend talking to the professor or professors in charge of the research before applying for an internship.
Interview Questions: They just asked for my basic information.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was simple, asked what I was studying and interested in along with my core values. Wanted to know about me more as a person to make sure I fit in with the positive culture than solid skill
Interview Questions: How do you live out the Jesuit Mission

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the principal investigator (PI) hiring you. Was invited to the PI's office to interview, and discussed basic responsibilities, background on the research being conducted, and why I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in my laboratory?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple, the typical interview questions about strengths/weaknesses, etc.  It took about 20 minutes.  They were not looking for anyone with experience, but were looking for someone with organizational skills.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Lab Accessioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from a HR recruiter and had a phone interview. We discussed the hiring practice and what the job duties were. Also the hours were discussed and the salary range.
Interview Questions: What were my strengths and weaknesses

title: Clerical/Sec SLUCARE Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long. I interviewed four times. Two of the interviews were in a panel.  The individuals that were to be present for the interviews did not show up when they were scheduled.  Then in order to fit the interview in they scheduled additional interviews and changed the times of the interviews several times.  There was no respect in regard to the applicants time.  This should have been my first sign.  I was requested to take several tests in the Human Resources department to which no one communicated my results.  Finallly, I waited nearly 19 weeks to hear back.  I emailed the interviewing department and the Human Resources department to inquire about the status of my application.  I never recieved any correspondence regarding the outcome of my interviews.  Additionally, I reached out to the Human Resources deparment for some sort of follow-up.  Keep in mind, I was perfectly happy to to accept if they had decided to seek another candidtate.  The hiring proces was entire process was unorganized and disappointing.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult experience with a customer?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: very friendly. routine questions. they care about why you choose them and try to find how fit you are. They gave me a tour to the campus too and the surrounding facilities.
Interview Questions: do you have a two-body issue?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Questions.  Interview was a group interview with over 8 people for the first stage which was a little overwhelming.  Subsequent one person interviews much more helpful.  More transparency as to employment status and pay would have been helpful.
Interview Questions: Important to know about the mission of the university

title: GIS Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: email the resume and cover letter to lab advisor, face to face interview, portfolio demonstration, certificate of related experience, recommendation is preferred. In this process, make a full preparation of portfolio is important. Reference sometimes can make you outstanding.
Interview Questions: What GIS portfolio do you have?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application, interview with 4-5 people, asked basic questions related to the job, background check after offer, no initial training on first day; it was not a difficult interview and there wasn't much to it
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself fitting in with SLU's mission?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 phone interviews with various people within the department. The interviewers were nice and personable, and I actually enjoyed talking to them. I personally felt that the interviews went well, but the day after the 3rd interview I received an email saying I was not selected. A few days after that, I saw that the position was re-posted on job boards with a different title but the same description. I am a little bit confused by the re-naming, but my guess would be that the original title was misleading and attracting the wrong candidates, and hence why I was not selected. Not a huge waste of time, but I did get excited for nothing.
Interview Questions: General science related questions

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Yes, the ultimate "terrible" interview question was asked by the person who would have been the direct line supervisor.  "If you could be any kind of animal, what kind would you be and why?"  
Come on!  Really???
What a waste of an interview questions!
The co-interviewer was clearly horrified!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Good job description on posting.  Interview contact provided more details in phone pre-screen.  Interview by panel of principal participants, one remote participant.  That was followed by a brief tour of the workplace and immediate campus areas.
Interview Questions: " Have you considered the scope of the project in relation to your previous experience and how would approach that aspect of the position?"

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took quite long.  From initial application to second interview was about 8+ weeks.  First had a phone interview, then invited for face interview, and finally the second interview.  Beware! The PI for the lab I was interviewing for promised a position in the lab (I assumed that I was not the leading candidate but they felt that both me and the leading candidate were strong enough for the position so they would create a position for me), yet after the second interview I got radio silence.
Interview Questions: Coming from a biochemistry background, I would be working with immunology so they asked how I think the transition would be like.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great and easy
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Athletics Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Saint Louis University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great and easy. Many people turn down their positions and they are often in dire need to fill positions. Make sure to ask questions to be clear what your responsibilities will be and your expectations will be.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple. Asked about why you wanted to do research and what your passions were. Questions about potential skills you have were touched. Some professors would like you to know what is covered in coursework more than others. A lot of what you need is to learn as you go.
Interview Questions: Why do you have an interest in our lab research?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first had a group interview, then a 3:1 interview. The questions were not too difficult to answer, but some required critical thinking. The interviewers were friendly and made me feel relaxed and comfortable during the interview. The 3:1 interview lasted around 20-25 minutes, leaving 5 minutes for me to ask questions or for me to go more in detail when answering questions.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that make you a good team member?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't a interview process because students will work with the professors that choose them.  They have periodic reviews for performance.  Also there is a risk the professor you are working with will leave.
Interview Questions: What previous experience prepares you for this?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was mainly the required essay that was submitted during your application to the graduate school/department/program. I also included an extensive CV, which helped showcase both my academic experiences, as well as skills acquired during other work experiences. Afterwards, the professor who was interested in working with me interviewed me over the phone. Basic questions, about what I saw myself doing with a SLU degree, why I chose the department, and why I fell I'm a good fit for his research were the main focus of the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing with your degree in ...?

title: Biochemist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: the interview went very well. The professor asked basic technique questions and no bahavior question at all. Got offer onsite. What else, I could not remember. I really could not remember the detailed questions.
Interview Questions: what you did during your graduate school?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Long and detailed process - multiple calls to references, skill testing, multiple interviews with various individuals in department and HR, employee health testing.  Required follow up on part of candidate, this is part of what separates those who succeed from those who don't, it should not discourage anyone who really wants to work at SLU.  Can be confusing, ask HR for clarification whenever you need it, they are very helpful
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The position was posted on their online career opportunities page that is regulated by human resources. Then, I applied online and submitted my cover letter and resume. A person from human resources called me and interviewed me. Then, I was interviewed by the department looking for the help. It was a group interview that consisted of the head of the research unit and a couple of the current project managers that worked there.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when your project had problems and how did you deal with those problems.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume and cover letter to the department chair with an indication of my interest to teach as adjunct. I was notified by email by an assistant dean that SLU was interested in pursuing an interview. The interview last approximately two hours and included several faculty members and department heads. All persons involved were friendly, helpful, and informed.
Interview Questions: How would you handle the situation of a failing student in your course?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: In-person contact with hiring manager, one-on-one screening, then panel interview.  The interview was rather long--it went for at least two hours.  The questions were rapid-fire and detailed.  I got the impression that one of the interviewers was using a psychological technique to reveal unconscious biases.  Although intense, it was not unfriendly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Saint Louis University in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews total. Two were panel, one individual. The first two rounds of interview were panel, the first being one of my "peers" and the second being a panel of Senior Staff level employees. In both interviews, a few of the panel members seemed less than thrilled to be there. They never made eye contact, hardly wrote anything down on their question sheet and continually checked their watch or the clock on the wall. The questions were all pretty standard. The one-on-one interview was with the Vice President. He was very friendly, but pretty much asked the same questions as the two previous interviews.
Interview Questions: How does diversity effect you in your daily life?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Louis University (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of one 30 minute phone interview with basic behavioral and skill based questions.  After phone interview, I was invited to a 2nd interview that consisted of 4 people.  Again, pretty basic personality, behavioral and skill based questions.  After 2nd interview, I had a 3rd interview with the CIO, IT Director, and manager.  This was the final interview and was nearly all personality type questions to see if I'd be a good fit.  After final interview I received an offer within a few days.  The offer was low but more than what I was making so I accepted.
Interview Questions: What is a decision that you regret making in your professional career?
